law.catch_line: Person elected to fill vacancy to take office immediately upon certification of results and administration of oath.
law.text: A successful candidate in a special election held for the purpose of filling a vacancy in any elective office shall take office immediately upon certification of the election results by the State Board of Elections or the county board of elections in which the special election was held, and administration of the oath of office.
law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 123, sec. 8, effective July 15, 2010. -- Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 48, sec. 50, effective July 13, 1990.
